radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Sestamibi Single Photon Emission Computed Tomography (SPECT)
radiographic_examinations.findings: Nonlocalizing results initially, revealed asymmetric uptake of the left submandibular gland on repeat imaging.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Asymmetry was also suggested in the retrospective review of the initial images.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Confirmed a mass in the left submandibular gland.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Sestamibi Single Photon Emission Computed Tomography (SPECT)
radiographic_examinations.findings: Showed uptake near the submandibular gland.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeated study revealed asymmetric uptake in the right thyroid bed and superior to the left thyroid lobe.
Surgeon noted asymmetric uptake in right level 2 in 2004.
